name: ROLLING STONES 'Was it only Rock 'n' Roll?' SongScape Poster!
description:
The Rolling Stones

‘Was it only Rock ‘n’ Roll?’

SongScape Poster

Featuring a SongScape of clues to 30 song titles in images from the band more often than not referred to as

"The Greatest Rock and Roll Band in the World" - The Rolling Stones.
 
Mick Jagger, Keith Richards, Charlie Watts & Ronnie Wood together with original band members Brian Jones and Bill Wyman and former guitarist Mick Taylor are all here in this tribute to British Rock Royalty.
 
Some obvious, some cryptic, these images include titles of many of the songs made famous by the Stones over more than 4 decades of  Rock’n’Roll World domination.
 
The Clues:
 
( Above the faces…)

Let’s spend the night together 
Wild horses 
Walking the dog 
Satisfaction 
Emotional Rescue 
Angie 
Under my thumb 
You can’t always get what you want 
Street fighting man 
Honky Tonk woman 
Get off of my cloud 
Gimme Shelter 
She’s a Rainbow 
Time is on my side 
Yesterday’s Papers
 
 ( Below the faces…)

Sitting on a fence 
Tumblin’ Dice 
Waiting on a friend 
Little Red Rooster 
Goodbye Ruby Tuesday 
It’s only Rock’n’Roll 
Heart of Stone 
19th. Nervous Breakdown 
Sympathy for the Devil 
Let it Bleed 
Paint it Black 
Start me up 
Jumpin’ Jack Flash 
Brown Sugar 
Miss you
 
Painted by the renowned Australian Artist Peter Van Breugel

All SongScapes are Limited Edition Prints of 1000 signed by the Artist.

This incredible tribute to The Rolling Stones music is an endless talking point over dinner with friends or just kicking back with a beer or something stronger listening to your fave Stones albums.

A list of all the 30 song titles comes with this amazing  print.

One look at this incredible Rolling Stones poster and you will have to have it on your wall.

Print size: 80cm x 60cm. (31.5" x 23.5")

It's printed on high quality thick paper and is a must for Stones fans and Art lovers alike.

All posters are shipped carefully rolled and placed in good strong tubes with plastic caps at both ends.
 
$11.50 Worlwide + $4.50 each additional. Insurance is optional - $10

name: BEATLES 'A Decade in the Life' New Edition SongScape Poster!
description:
THE BEATLES 

 "A Decade in the Life" 

SongScape Poster

At long last, A new edition of "A Decade in the Life" is  available!

The first Print of this amazing Poster sold out almost 2 years ago.

This Limited Edition SongScape Print contains 52 Beatles song title images.

Some Notes from the Artist:

Other features in the design include each of the fab four faces being in a separate music bar (in a four bar staff) Also, the music notes floating from the guitar travel behind all four heads and then into the core of the apple, representing the world (as well as an altered logo). 

The bite from the apple is the impression they made on the world and music. 

The four faces themselves are actually reverse images, as they would be seen looking into a mirror, to represent  “a reflection and tribute to the decade, the music and the memory of a band that inspired the world “. 

The rainbow that starts from Lennon’s head also starts with the colours upside down, with it’s reflections in their hair, then rights itself coming from McCartney’s tie runs around Harrison’s  collar  then explodes from the sun, again upside down, above the New York skyline. Beside this is San Francisco’s Golden Gate bridge.

The same top right side corner represents the influences of Bob Dylan, Elvis, The Beach Boys, and the U.S.A. at the time of “Flower Power “ and the Vietnam War. It includes a marijuana leaf. 

The ribbon thrown by the “ Fool On The Hill “ cuts through Ringo’s collar, goes through the window, and becomes Harrison’s collar. 

The silver beetle under Lennon’s collar represents a name the band used for a brief time before settling on “ The Beatles. “ 

The word “ Transcend “, above Harrison , refers to his Indian and Hare Krishna influences. The four large luminous blue stars simply represent the “ fab four. “ One is overlapped by a hand holding a gun, this refers to both Lennon’s song “ Happiness Is A Warm Gun “ and the gun that killed him.  It points to the walrus holding a white dove. “Give Peace A Chance” 

A list of all the 52 song titles is included with the print. 

The Clues:

Across The Universe
Let It Be
All You Need Is Love
Lucy In The Sky With Diamonds
Back In The U.S.S.R
Maxwell’s Silver Hammer
Because
Michelle
Being For The Benefit Of Mr. Kite
Norwegian Wood (This Bird Has Flown)
Birthday
Nowhere Man
Blackbird
Octopus’s Garden
Can’t Buy Me Love
One After 909
Carry That Weight
Paperback Writer
Drive My Car
Penny Lane
# 9 Dream 
Rain
Eleanor Rigby
Revolution
Fixing A Hole
Rocky Raccoon
Give peace a chance
Run For Your Life
Good Day Sunshine
Sgt. Pepper’s Lonely Hearts Club Band
Happiness Is A Warm Gun
She Came In Through The Bathroom Window
Help!
She’s Leaving Home
Her Majesty
Strawberry Fields Forever
Here Comes The Sun
Taxman
Hey Jude
Tell Me Why
Honey Pie
The Fool On The Hill
I Am The Walrus
The Long And Winding Road
I’ll Cry Instead
Ticket To Ride
If I Fell
When I’m Sixty Four
I’m Only Sleeping
While My Guitar Gently Weeps
Lady Madonna
Yellow Submarine

Painted by the renowned Australian Artist Peter Van Breugel

All SongScapes are Limited Edition Prints of 1000

 This incredible tribute to The Beatles music is an endless talking point over dinner with friends or just kicking back with a beer or something stronger listening to your fave Beatles albums.

One look at this incredible BEATLES poster and you will have to have it on your wall.
Print size: 80cm x 60cm. (31.5" x 23.5")

It's printed on high quality thick paper and is a must for Beatles fans and Art lovers alike.

All posters are shipped carefully rolled and placed in good strong tubes with plastic caps at both ends.
 
$11.50 Worlwide + $4.50 each additional. Insurance is optional - $10

name: PINK FLOYD - 'The Dark Side of the Wall' SongScape Poster!
description:
PINK FLOYD

'The Dark Side of the Wall'

SongScape Poster

The Syd Barrett Edition

Featuring a SongScape of clues to 25 song titles in images from the band that gave us the Legendary Albums Dark Side of the Moon and The Wall.
Some obvious, some cryptic, these images also include titles from the early works Piper At the Gates Of Dawn, A Saucerful of Secrets, Atom Heart Mother & Obscured by Clouds as well as Dark Side, Wish You Were Here & The Wall

This Special Syd Barrett Edition Print is dedicated to Syd’s memory and features an image of Syd and images of his songs including Pink Floyd’s first Singles, Arnold Layne & See Emily Play.

The Clues:
Arnold Layne 
See Emily Play 
Atom Heart Mother 
Astronomy Domine 
Careful With That Axe, Eugene 
Set the Controls for the Heart of the Sun 
A Saucerful of Secrets 
Grantchester Meadows 
Several Species of Small Furry Animals Gathered Together in a Cave and Grooving With a Pict 
Obscured By Clouds 
Eclipse
Brain Damage 
Money 
Time 
Us and Them 
Shine On You Crazy Diamond 
Wish You Were Here 
Have a Cigar 
Bike 
Pigs on the Wing 
Dogs 
Sheep 
Another Brick in the Wall 
Vera 
Comfortably Numb

Painted by the renowned Australian Artist Peter Van Breugel

All SongScapes are Limited Edition Prints of 1000 signed by the Artist.

This incredible tribute to Pink Floyd's music is an endless talking point over dinner with friends or just kicking back with a beer or something stronger listening to your fave Floyd albums.

A list of all the 25 song titles comes with this amazing print.
One look at this incredible PINK FLOYD poster and you will have to have it on your wall.

Print size: 80cm x 60cm. (31.5" x 23.5")

It's printed on high quality thick paper and is a must for Floyd fans and Art lovers alike.

All posters are shipped carefully rolled and placed in good strong tubes with plastic caps at both ends.
 
$11.50 Worlwide + $4.50 each additional. Insurance is optional - $10

name: BOB DYLAN 1978 OZ/NZ Far East TOUR POSTER!
description:
BOB DYLAN

1978 OZ/NZ Far East 

TOUR POSTER!


25 years on this beautiful original painting has been dusted off and brought back to life by Chris Grosz and is proudly published for the first time with all the Tour dates & venues. Bob Dylan, the most influential Artist of our time and that special moment in Australian Rock Graphic Art, are finally reunited. 

This very special 65cm x 45cm (25.5" x 17.5") poster is Printed in glorious full colour Offset on 250gsm Silky Art stock. 

Check it out on my website : www.offbeat.com.au/dylanfe.htm

Each print of the very limited run has been individually signed by Chris Grosz (See pic. of signing on my website) and is ready to frame and should be shipped in a strong tube $11.50 Worlwide + $4.50 each additional. Insurance is optional - $10
